newsitem.title: JAPAN: Nippon Express down following profit announcement.
newsitem.headline: Nippon Express down following profit announcement.

text.p: Shares of Nippon Express Co Ltd were sharply lower on Wednesday afternoon following its announcement on Tuesday of poor half-year earnings.
Nippon Express was traded at 881 yen at 0534 GMT, down 27 yen from the Tuesday's close.
Japan's largest transport company said on Tuesday that it posted parent current profit of 19.46 billion yen in the six months to September 30, down from 20.33 billion yen in the year-ago period.
It also said that it expected 1996/97 full-year parent current profit of 45 billion yen, down from an actual profit of 47.36 billion yen in 1995/96.
Market sources said earlier on Wednesday that Nomura Research Institute Ltd had downgraded Nippon Express to a "2" rating from its previous "1".

In its three-grade rating system, the research institute assigns a "2" rating to issues whose values it sees moving within 10 percentage points in either direction of the key 225-share Nikkei average over the next six months.
